title: Bernwood Forest Walking Route

images.title: Jackie Harman / Bernwood Forest
images.caption: Enclosed meadow in Shabbington Wood, Bernwood Forest.

images.title: Jackie Harman / Bernwood Meadow, Bernwood Forest
images.caption: Bernwood Meadow, Bernwood Forest. A BBONT Nature reserve. A Site of Special Scientific Interest and a haven for butterflies.The grass is mowed once a year.

images.title: Jackie Harman / Entrance to Bernwood Forest
images.caption: Entrance to the forest. Taken from just inside the entrance on the Oakley road. Bernwood Forest is an ancient forest dating back to the 12th century. At one time it covered many parishes. Nowadays it is a Site of Special Scientific Interest and several species of Butterflies may be found here.

images.title: Steve Daniels / Hide in Bernwood Forest
images.caption: Bird hide in the woods where you can look out for a variety of winged visitors

description: This large area of woodland is located a few miles north east of Oxford city centre. It's a nice peaceful place to go for a walk if you are visiting the area. In the woods you'll find a number of footpaths including a Butterfly trail where you can look out for over 40 species of butterfly. You can start the walk at the car park on Oakley Road (postcode below). From here you can pick up the trails heading through Oakley Wood, Shabbington Wood and Waterperry Wood to the south. The Bernwood Jubilee Way also runs through the forest. This waymarked, long distance trail was devised to celebrate the Queen's Golden Jubilee. It runs for 61 miles and explores the area that was once The Royal Hunting Forest of Bernwood.
